channel.title: Introductory R tutorial on Columbia Psychology Scientific Computing
channel.description: Recent content in Introductory R tutorial on Columbia Psychology Scientific Computing

item.title: Descriptives
item.description: Return home Goals for this tutorial: 0. Open dataset and load package 1. Familiarize yourself with the data 2. Selecting relevant variables 3. Basic Descriptives Summarizing data 4. Grouping data 5. Extra: Working with a long dataset How many unique subjects are in the data Make sure you know how many trials there were per subj. Combine summary statistics with the full data frame 6.

item.title: Getting your data ready for analysis
item.description: Return home Goals of this lesson Install Packages Getting your Data into R Entering data directly Reading data into R Inspecting your data How is your data frame structured? Brief intro to tidyverse Rename a variable Check for missing data Check for correct values Filtering data Getting ready for analysis Recoding variables Calculating new variables Combining data from multiple sources Shaping data Saving your work Data Challenge!

item.title: Modeling
item.description: Basics for modeling in R Functions: Basic models Syntax: Basic model formula To add multiple factors Interactions Output of models Linear models Anova Visualizing models Advanced models Welcome to the lesson on modeling in R! Goals: 1. Learn about functions and syntax for models in R 2. Practice examples of different model types 3. Understand how to obtain model results in R

item.title: Plotting Tutorial Using ggplot2!
item.description: Return home 0: What is this tutorial? Whatâ€™s ggplot2? 1: First Load Tidyverse, which includes ggplot2! 2: Load in Sample Data (NHANES) 3: Scatter Plot & Basic ggplot Syntax 3a: Histograms with ggplot 4: Dot Plot Organized by Grouping Factor 4a: Visualizing Distributions with Violin Plots 5: Summary Plots 6: Fitting Lines To The Data 7: Titles, Axis Labels 7: Facetting 8: Color 9: Themes 10: Saving To Files 11: Heatmaps 12: Basic Time Series Plot 13: Final Points Return home Click here to return to the main CU psychology R tutorials page.
